conclusion: Understand the behavior of light traveling from air to water using Snell's Law and refraction properties.
Incident ray is the line AO1, refracted ray is the line OB.
Snell's Law relates the sines of the angles of incidence and refraction to the speeds of light in two media.
Angle of incidence is between incident ray and normal; angle of refraction is between refracted ray and normal.
Light travels from air to water, speed decreases, angle of refraction is less than angle of incidence.
Light bends towards the normal as it enters water.
Refracted ray OB is closer to the normal than incident ray AO1, so O1 is to the left of O.
Statement 'O1 point is to the right of O point' is incorrect; O1 is to the left of O.
